intro: Canthium griseum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
